title: Highest Net Lending as a Percentage of GDP
description: In 2020, Nauru achieved a net lending rate of 32.76% of its GDP, indicating a strong fiscal position compared to other nations.

title: Leading in Revenue Excluding Grants
description: Nauru's revenue, excluding grants, was 138.99% of its GDP in 2020, showcasing its ability to generate substantial income independently.

title: High Tax Revenue as a Percentage of GDP
description: In 2020, tax revenue in Nauru accounted for 44.40% of its GDP, reflecting a robust tax collection system.

title: Significant Domestic Health Expenditure
description: Nauru allocated 15.79% of its GDP to domestic general government health expenditure in 2022, prioritizing healthcare investment.

title: High Prevalence of Tobacco Use Among Adults
description: As of 2022, 48.3% of adults in Nauru were current tobacco users, indicating a significant public health challenge.

title: High Tobacco Use Among Female Adults
description: In 2022, 48.1% of female adults in Nauru were current tobacco users, highlighting a concerning trend in female health.

title: Substantial Government Expenses Relative to GDP
description: Nauru's government expenses were 103.73% of its GDP in 2020, indicating high public spending levels.

title: Strong Financial Asset Acquisition
description: In 2020, Nauru's net acquisition of financial assets was 30.74% of its GDP, reflecting a proactive approach to asset management.

title: Lowest Greenhouse Gas Emissions
description: In 2023, Nauru's total greenhouse gas emissions, excluding LULUCF, were just 0.0012 Mt CO2e, one of the lowest globally.

title: Minimal Methane Emissions from Agriculture
description: Nauru's methane emissions from agriculture were only 0.0003 Mt CO2e in 2023, reflecting minimal agricultural impact on the environment.

title: Low Nitrous Oxide Emissions from Industrial Processes
description: In 2023, Nauru's nitrous oxide emissions from industrial processes were a mere 0.0001 Mt CO2e, indicating limited industrial activity.

title: Small Population of Elderly
description: As of 2023, Nauru had a total population of 318 individuals aged 65 and above, one of the smallest elderly populations worldwide.

title: Limited Scientific Output
description: In 2022, Nauru produced only 0.27 scientific and technical journal articles, highlighting a need for increased research and development.

title: Low Female Teacher Training in Primary Education
description: Only 8.33% of female teachers in Nauru's primary education were trained in 2023, indicating a gap in educational development.

title: Minimal Personal Remittances Received
description: In 2023, Nauru received $880,605.81 in personal remittances, one of the lowest figures globally, reflecting limited diaspora contributions.

title: Low Imports of Goods and Services
description: Nauru's imports of goods and services in 2023 amounted to $152,155,542.14, indicating a small-scale economy.
